content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an implementation of your request in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks and their contents
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seed=1))
    
    # Combine the contents of each match (without the fences) into a single string
    joined_code = join([match[1] for match in matches], "\n")
    
    return joined_code
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all code blocks and their contents. It then joins these together with newline characters, effectively removing the fences. Note that this assumes that there are no nested code blocks or other special cases not handled by your request.
